column4: hey all, im running ubuntu server, i think it's 6.04 and the version of privoxy that apt-get installs is an old version which doesn't support socks5 ... how do i upgrade privoxy manually? Must I do a dist-upgrade?
and how likely is a dist-upgrade to break the services im running now?
We're at 10.04.
and im running server
Ahh, I see. >_>
still supported for another year
Either !backport or check Launchpad for updated ppa/deb of the said package.
thanks
No problem. Good luck.
btw, how likely is a dist-upgrade to break my running services (mediawiki is the most important one)
I can't say anything as it is difficult to foretell the future. However, you are always advised to make backups first.
privoxy?
yeah
What are you on and what are you looking for? Why the needs to update?
Privoxy version 3.0.8 - newest is 3.0.16, my version supports socks4 and 4a, but I use a tunnel - aka socks5
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuBackports
There are #Installing a single package but there are also "#How to request new packages"
You should try and request. Wait few days. See if things are going your way.
interesting... how activly is this maintained?
I have no slight idea -- but I imagine it's well active. I used backport kernels for my netbook to work with wifi.
cool, requesting
